result.execSummary:
The defendant William G Paulus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent.

Comply with treatment orders of mental health providers and take prescriptions as prescribed.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268 paid in full from bond.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

CASH BAIL TO REVERT TO SIGNATURE BOND ON MONDAY, MAY 12, 2014 AT 8:00 A.M. AND MUST REPORT DIRECTLY TO THE BAIL MONITORING PROGRAM
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring. Cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $1,000.00  per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Maureen O
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not be at or on or around West Clover Lane in Cottage Grove WI
- Defendant shall take all mental health medications as prescribed
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 2

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
